DOC.brief_summary: The primary objective study determine whether Ovation Abdominal Stent Graft System safe effective method treat abdominal aortic aneurysm ( AAA 's ) patient consider suitable candidate open surgical repair .
DOC.brief_title: Clinical Study TriVascular Ovation™ Abdominal Stent Graft System
DOC.detailed_description: This Phase II prospective , consecutive enrolling , non-randomized multi-center clinical evaluation safety effectiveness Ovation Abdominal Stent Graft System use treatment patient AAA ( Treatment Group ) compare performance goal ( Control Group ) . 150 study patient enrol 40 institution . An additional 100 study patient enrol continued access phase .
DOC.criteria: Inclusion/ Inclusion Criteria All patient must meet follow inclusion criterion eligible enrollment study : 1 . Patient > 18 year age 2 . Patients male nonpregnant female ( female child bear potential must negative pregnancy test prior enrollment study ) 3 . Patient sign Institutional Review Board ( IRB ) approve Informed Consent Form 4 . Patient consider treat physician candidate elective open surgical repair AAA ( i.e. , category I , II , III per American Society Anesthesiology ( ASA ) classification . ASA category IV patient may enrol provided life expectancy great 1 year . 5 . Patient infrarenal abdominal aortic aneurysm meet least one following : Abdominal aortic aneurysm ≥5.0 cm diameter Aneurysm increase size 0.5 cm last 6 month . Maximum diameter aneurysm exceed 1.5 time transverse dimension adjacent nonaneurysmal aortic segment 6 . Patient patent iliac femoral artery allow endovascular access TriVascular Ovation Abdominal Stent Graft System . 7 . Patient suitable nonaneurysmal proximal aortic neck length ≥ 7 mm inferior distal renal artery ostium . 8 . Patient suitable nonaneurysmal distal iliac artery length ( seal zone ) ≥10 mm . The resultant repair preserve patency least one hypogastric artery . 9 . Patient suitable nonaneurysmal proximal aortic neck luminal diameter 16 30 mm . 10 . Patient suitable nonaneurysmal distal iliac luminal diameter 8 20 mm . 11 . Patient meet follow anatomic criterion : distance distal renal artery superior internal iliac artery measurement least 13 cm . 12 . Patient juxtarenal aortic neck angulation ≤ 60º proximal neck ≥10 mm ≤ 45º proximal neck < 10 mm . 13 . Patient must willing comply require followup exam . Exclusion Criteria Patients meet ANY follow eligible enrollment study : 1 . Patient dissect aneurysm 2 . Patient acutely rupture aneurysm 3 . Patient acute vascular injury 4 . Patient need emergent surgery 5 . Patient known thoracic aortic aneurysm dissection . 6 . Patient mycotic aneurysm active systemic infection 7 . Patient unstable angina ( define angina progressive increase symptom , new onset rest nocturnal angina , onset prolonged angina ) 8 . Patient myocardial infarction ( MI ) and/or stroke ( CVA ) within past 6 month . 9 . Patient major surgical interventional procedure plan ≤30 day AAA repair . 10 . Patient history connective tissue disease ( e.g. , Marfan 's Ehler'sDanlos syndrome ) . 11 . Patient history bleed disorder refuse blood transfusion . 12 . Patient dialysis dependent renal failure baseline serum creatinine level > 2.0 mg/dl 13 . Patient known hypersensitivity contraindication anticoagulation contrast medium amenable pretreatment . 14 . Patient know allergy intolerance polytetrafluoroethylene ( PTFE ) , PEGbased polymer , fluorinated ethylene propylene ( FEP ) nitinol . 15 . Patient body habitus would inhibit Xray visualization aorta 16 . Patient limited life expectancy le 1 year 17 . Patient currently participate another investigational device drug clinical trial 18 . Patient medical , social psychological condition , opinion investigator , preclude receive pretreatment , require treatment , posttreatment procedure evaluation .
